org.openimaj.image.processing.face.detection

Enum FaceDetectorFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<FaceDetectorFeatures>
      • org.openimaj.image.processing.face.detection.FaceDetectorFeatures
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<FaceDetectorFeatures>

    public enum FaceDetectorFeatures
extends Enum<FaceDetectorFeatures>
    Simple features that can be extracted from a list of detected faces and an image. Contains things like the count of faces, bounding boxes, etc.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      AREA
      Get the relative area of each detected face (normalised by the image area).
      BLOBS
      Get the set of pixels describing each face.
      BOX
      Get the bounding box describing each face.
      COUNT
      Count the faces in the image.
      ORIBOX
      Get the oriented bounding box describing each face.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • COUNT

        public static final FaceDetectorFeatures COUNT
        Count the faces in the image. Returns the count as a single element, 1-dimensional MultidimensionalIntFV.

      • BLOBS

        public static final FaceDetectorFeatures BLOBS
        Get the set of pixels describing each face. Returns the result as a 2d MultidimensionalIntFV where each row has interlaced x and y values: x1, y1, x2, y2, ... The returned feature is not square; the length of each row is dependent on the number of pixels associated with the respective face.

      • BOX

        public static final FaceDetectorFeatures BOX
        Get the bounding box describing each face. The bounding boxes are encoded as a 2D MultidimensionalIntFV with each row corresponding to a face. Each row is encoded as the x, y, width, height values of the bounding box.

      • ORIBOX

        public static final FaceDetectorFeatures ORIBOX
        Get the oriented bounding box describing each face. The bounding boxes are encoded as a 2D MultidimensionalIntFV with each row corresponding to a face. Each row is encoded as the the four corners of the bounding box: x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4.

      • AREA

        public static final FaceDetectorFeatures AREA
        Get the relative area of each detected face (normalised by the image area). The returned feature is a 1D DoubleFV with each element corresponding to an individual face detection.
